text: Beyti is a type of Turkish meat dish. During a visit to Switzerland in 1961, Beyti Güler was inspired by the renowned butcher Möller's way of preparing meat. When he returned home, he introduced a dish consisting of roasted lamb fillets wrapped in strips of lamb cutlet fat. It came to be named after him when the kebap's fame spread all over the world. == References == Category:Middle Eastern foods
title: Beyti (meat dish)
